lines.text: All that's left is in baskets.
[the bodies of the campers were dismembered and Isley and his workers come to the Indian village going after John Hawks thinking he had something to do with it]
Here try this.
[back at the cabin Maggie makes the fish that the Doctor caught during the day and waits for him to have some]
Aphrodesia.
[Dr. Verne OK's the fish after a good taste test]
You think you can catch some more.
Are you kidding. I'm one of the World's great fisherman.
Well you do the fishing and I'll do the eating.
Sounds like a good relationship.
There are underground tunnels beneath the frost line to store perishables.
[M'Rai talks at the old Indian village site with Dr. Verne and his wife Maggie ]
The forest provides more than a man could possibly need. Things grow big here... real big.
Well, I saw a salmon that took my breath away.
It is the garden of Eden.
I've never let anyone here, you are the first to see.
Can these people help us?
[Dr. Verne after saving a dieing mutant cub and treating it in a tent at the Indian site referring to some Indian men who are with Hawks]
They can send someone from the village.
Send them. Tell them to get people here. I want people to see this. Is there a newspaper in town?
Yes.
Get them here with a camera... and people from that paper mill... and that sheriff.
Not that sheriff. I can't do that.
Hawkes! He'll see the truth here and you have more here at stake in this truth than I have.
I believe him.
Why?
Why would he have offered to let you test the water?
Maybe it wasn't in the water.
Huh?
Maybe it's heavier than water. That silvery stuff on your boot, is it dry?
Yes.
They gave us a trick question in medical school. What's the only liquid in the world that isn't wet?
What was the answer?
Mercury.
